result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Chad R Studier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Count 3 and 4.
14A 017261 (Money returned to bond on 7/3/14 in order to correct assessment)
14A 017253 (Money returned to bond on 7/3/14 in order to correct assessment)
Successful completion of diversion court.

Defendant Chad R Studier in court with attorney Michael R Cohen.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:09 Case called.  State advises this is a successful completion of diversion court and recites agreement.  VIS filed.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

Count 1:  State moves to amend to simple disorderly conduct 947.01 (Class B misdemeanor) - Granted - Guilty plea
Count 2:  State moves to amend to simple disorderly conduct 947.01 (Class B misdemeanor) - Granted - Guilty plea
Count 3:  Dismiss
Count 4 - Dismiss

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  State relates.  Attorney Cohen relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

$100 fine plus costs including DNA surcharge on each count - $500 cash bond to be applied with 60 DTP remainder
Barron County Diversion Court Worksheet.
Barron County Diversion Court Worksheet.

Defendant Chad R Studier in court with attorney Michael R Cohen.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court confirms defendant's are present. Court addresses all defendants and explains the process of Diversion Court. Court advises all defendants to bring with them to Court their Deferred Prosecution Agreements. Court discusses the meaning of smart goals and how to develop a timeline to accomplish these goals. Forms were given to defendants for their goals.

State relates that the following has been completed by the defendant. 
The $50.00 diversion fee has been paid. He has enrolled in the Domestic Violence Anger Management Program. Completed first 4 weeks out of 10 weeks. Defense relates and indicates the AODA has been completed. 
Court questions defendant. 
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 2, 2014 at 08:00 am.

Defendant Chad R Studier in court with attorney Michael R. Cohen.  Angela L. Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Diversion court set for 5/29/14 at 2:00 PM
Bond to continue.  Hearing scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea hearing on April 9, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
